A little bit of technique first.

Tempo ♩ = 100 bpm

None but the Lonely Heart. Andante non tanto Op.6 by P. Tchaïkovski

item.title: 28th October 2020
item.description: Practice Sessions This new section aims to showcase the kind of things that I am practicing along the week. Technique Bowing: School of…
item.content:encoded:
Practice Sessions

This new section aims to showcase the kind of things that I am practicing along the week.

Technique

  • Bowing: School of Bowing, Op. 2 Part. III by Otakar Ševčík

  • Glisandos: A practical Method for the Violin Part 2 by Nicolas Laoureux (3rd position)

  • 100 Etudes Op. 32, Book 1 by Hans Sitt

  • Trills: Preparatory Trill Studies Op.7 Part 1 by Otakar Ševčík

  • Chromatic Scale: Contemporary Violin Technique Vol 1 Part 1 by Galamian et al.

Pieces

  • Danzas rumanas I. Joc cu bata by Béla Bartók

  • Concerto Op.3 I.Allegro by Antonio Vivaldi

Chromatic Scale

1st variation: 1122334. This marks the left-hand fingers played.

2nd variation: 1212340.

Danzas rumanas I. Joc cu bata by Béla Bartók

80 bpm

100 bpm

item.title: 22nd October 2020
item.description: Trills In order to understand the exercises practiced the following images will be useful. Corchea/Quaver/Eighth note In this setup we try…
item.content:encoded:
Trills

In order to understand the exercises practiced the following images will be useful.

Corchea/Quaver/Eighth note

In this setup we try to play two notes per compass (marked by the metronome).

Tresillo/Triplet

In this setup we try to play three notes per compass.

Semi corchea/Semiquaver/Sixteenth note

In this setup we try to play four notes per compass.

Seisillo/Sextuplet

In this setup we try to play six notes per compass.

Fusa/Demisemiquaver/Thirty-second Note

In this setup we try to play eighth notes per compass.

item.title: 14th October 2020
item.description: Trills I started learning trills, so here I just talk how I practice them. Concerto Op. 3 N. 6 I. Allegro Vivaldi 60 bpm (♩ tempo) Now the…
item.content:encoded:
Trills

I started learning trills, so here I just talk how I practice them.

Concerto Op. 3 N. 6 I. Allegro Vivaldi 60 bpm (♩ tempo)

Now the tempo is marking quarter notes instead of eigth notes.

Danzas rumanas I. Joc cu bata by Béla Bartók

This is a really difficult piece at the beginning. So, I am studing it using two approaches: one is by just by feeling comfortable playing the piece and the other is by paying attention to the tempo.

item.title: 16th September 2020
item.description: Here it’s presented the first attempt at playing both pieces at 80bpm. There are clear mistakes, but I am also trying to correct the right…
item.content:encoded:
Here it’s presented the first attempt at playing both pieces at 80bpm.

There are clear mistakes, but I am also trying to correct the right hand grip. Right now I am grabing the bow more like in the Russian method (right side of image), but I am trying to do it like the Franco-Belgian one (left side of image).

Étude N. 12 Laoureux Book II 80bpm

Concerto Op. 3 N. 6 I. Allegro Vivaldi 80bpm

Suggestion: Watch it at 2x 😉

item.description: Pieces played: Petite ecole de la mélodie: 20 petites pièces très faciles pour le violon avec accomp. de piano en 3 suites by Charles Dancla…
item.content:encoded:
Pieces played:

  • Petite ecole de la mélodie: 20 petites pièces très faciles pour le violon avec accomp. de piano en 3 suites by Charles Dancla Op.123 Suite 1 Romance.
  • Very Easy Melodious Exercises in the First Position by Edward Elgar Op.22: n.1

Practicing

Petite école de la mélodie: 12 petites pièces by Charles Dancla Op. 123 N. 1 Romance

Filmed: 2019 - Nov - 17
